inn1.comm: flicks it to the leg side for a brace
tucked to mid-wicket
defends it down the pitch off the backfoot
bowls it on off stump, defended back down the pitch
fires it wide outside off, Porterfield lets it go to the keeper
drags his length back and gets significant bounce, Porterfield doesn't bother going after it and lets it go to the wicketkeeper
bowls it way outside off, not bothered with by the batsman
fuller ball, driven straight to cover
left alone outside off
comes forward and defends it down the pitch
good length ball, beats the outside edge on its way to the wicketkeeper
works it square towards third man for a single
played off the backfoot and ball goes down the pitch
short and wide from Worrall, cut away to deep backward point
defended off the backfoot and the ball goes down the pitch
flicked away to the man at midwicket
comes forward and blocks it down the pitch
fires it down the leg side, looks to flick it but wears it on the pad
comes forward to defend and the ball goes straight down the ground
played off the backfoot past the bowler. The outfield is quick, which allows them to take three
some movement there, beats the outside edge, and the ball goes to the keeper
good length ball outside off, fends it off to short cover without much movement of the feet
played off the backfoot, and ball rolls down the ground
good length outside off, played beautifully through the covers, and ball races to the boundary. Driven crisply
played off the backfoot and the ball rolls down the ground
good length ball on middle stump, doesn't move his feet much but manages to work it to covers
played off the backfoot, straight to the cover fielder
length ball on off, works it to covers
defends it off the front foot back to the bowler
good length, nudges it to the leg side
sliced to third man for a brace
beaten! Doesn't move his feet at all as he tries to drive and the ball shoots past the inside edge
short of a length and darting back in to him, keeps low as well and Stirling is beaten
steered to third man for a single
gets it away to backward point off the backfoot
width on offer, slashes at it and gets it away to third man
short, wide and cut away to sweeper cover
Porterfield pulls the ball over the top of long leg and the ball goes all the way for a six! Great shot from the Ireland Captain
clips the ball off the pads and goes into the legside
gets onto the front foot and defends the ball into the covers
ts wide of off stump and Porterfield is happy to defend the ball towards point to finish the over
Boland comes in for his first ball and Stirling is happy to defend the ball back up the pitch
its another cracking shot from Stirling, he clips the ball in the air over the top of square leg and the ball goes to the boundary
good length ball from the bowler, Stirling gets on to the front foot and defends back to the bowler
Stirling gets on the front foot again and plays a late cut down to third man, they jog the single
Boland beats Porterfield's defensive push and is unlucky not to get an edge through to the keeper
another good length ball from Boland Porterfield gets in line and defends the ball back down the pitch

Stirling gets the over off to a good start by smashing the ball back over the bowler's head. The umpires have sent it upstairs to see if its a six or a four. Upon Close-ups, it looks like it could have been a six, but its given as four
drives the ball hard into cover and its a smart stop by the fielder
punches the ball over the top of cover and it races to the rope. The fielder can only turn their heads and watch the ball go. The fielder can only turn their heads and watch the ball go
Worral goes short and you can see Stirling's eyes light up as he pulls the ball to the square leg boundary. Beats the fielder and its another Boundary for the Irish
clips the ball off the leg to short fine leg
turns the ball into the on-side and the fielder runs in to stop the ball. 12 off the over for Ireland
Boland bowls a straight ball and it's easy for Porterfield to clip the ball through square leg
Stirling hits the ball in the air towards cover point, just couldn't get on top of the ball. Ends up hitting it straight into the fielder's hands. First wicket gone.
wide of off-stump and Andetrson lets the ball go through to the keeper
another tempter outside off, Anderson is leaving these balls well alone today.
much straighter ball from Boland, Anderson stays in the crease and clips the ball into the legside
Last ball of the powerplay and Anderson is happy to defend the ball back down the pitch
a real loosener to start from Marsh, its wide and short. Porterfield swings at the ball and hits it hard back past the bowler, runs quick over the outfield and brings up the fifty for Ireland
goes down the legside, called a wide
Chance for Australia, Porterfield goes for another cross-batted shot and gets a bottom-edge. It's a tough chance for Wade and as he dives forward he can't keep hold of the ball.
gets onto the front foot and defends the ball back down the pitch
clips the ball towards midwicket and it's an easy single for Porterfeld
too straight from Marsh and it's easy for Anderson to move across the stumps and glance the ball to the fine leg boundary
Lovely shot from Anderson, full and straight again from Marsh. Leans into the shot and drives it back past the bowler. Goes all the way to the boundary again
Boland continues, 141ks, and Porterfield clips him through square leg, they jog the single
far too wide outside off-stump and it's another wide for Australia
an inswinger from Boland, Anderson stays in the crease and defends the ball into the legside
full outside off stump and Anderson pulls the bat out of the way, lets the ball go through to Wade behind the stumps
its short and sits up nicely for Anderson,  pulled through midwicket and even though its not hit too cleanly goes all the way to the rope
a good comeback ball form Boland, tucks Anderson up for room and he can only defend the ball back down the pitch
gets onto the front foot and defends the ball back to the bowler again
on legstump and it's clipped to square leg
much slower through the air, Porterfield goes for the reverse-sweep, doesn't hit it cleanly and it just goes past the keeper
stays in the crease and clips the ball through the legside
gets onto the front foot and drives the ball through the covers, the sweeper runs over and tidies up the ball
loops the ball up and it gets defended back to the bowler
goes down the legside, wide

Another wicket goes down! Its the flipper from Zampa and Porterfield looks to pull the ball into the legside. It keeps low and hits him in front of the stumps. Porterfield knew that he was gone and didn't even need to look at the umpire. Head down and kept walking back
off-side wide
much better ball and it's much nearer the stumps, gets defended into the covers
a little less pace from Marsh, Anderson gets on the front foot and defends
gets the edge and it flies to the where second slip would have been. Anderson pushed hard at the ball and there is no third man to prevent the boundary
gets onto the front foot and leans into the shot, directed to mid-wicket
Marsh strays onto the leg stump again and it's easily clipped out to deep square leg
Wilson gets onto the front foot and defends his first ball into the covers
Anderson goes back in the crease and waits for the turn, cuts the ball out to deep point
Wilson gets down early and paddles the ball down to fine leg
gets onto the front foot and defends the ball into the covers
Wilson shuffles down the pitch and gets to the pitch of the ball. Defended on the front foot
Wilson hits a full ball into the covers, calls for the run. Warner gets the ball back in quicky and Wade takes off the bails. They have a look at the TV pictures but Anderson was home
Sweeps the ball wide of fine leg to get another run
back of the length ball from Marsh, Anderson pulls the ball through midwicket
good length ball from Marsh, hits Wilson on the handle of the bat and its goes into the off side
another short ball from Marsh, its wide of off stump and Wilson misses with his slash at the ball
Much straighter again from Marsh, clips the ball to deep square leg
good length ball outside off stump and Wilson gets into the front foot and defends into the covers
slower ball clipped into the leg side again and that's drinks
hit out to sweeper cover
Zampa drops short and is pulled up to long-on
waits in the crease and hits the ball out to the cover sweeper again
gets on the front foot and defends the ball into the on side
comes down the pitch and defends the ball into the off side this time
starts off wide of the leg stump, hits Wilson on the pad and its goes into the legside. Wade runs from behind the stumps and collects the ball
Marsh continues with a shorter ball. Anderson gets in line and defends the ball back to the bowler
a wild ball from Marsh, its far too short and goes over the top of the batsman's head. Even Wade behind the stumps can't stop it and it goes all the way to the boundary. Wides
it's a much better ball outside off stump and Anderson gets his bat out of the way and lets it go through to the keeper
Anderson gets onto the front foot and drives the ball into the covers, Zampa dives to his left and stops the ball
a good length ball and it pops up off the pitch, it suprises Anderson a little and he does well to defend the ball back down the pitch

it's a short ball and Anderson pulls the ball in the air into the legside. Boland dives forward and gets his hands on the ball. He isn't sure that he got his fingers underneath the ball and so they have gone upstairs to check. Looks a tough one to see if he got his fingers enough under the ball. The TV Umpire gives him the benefit of the doubt. Not Out is the final verdict
Wilson looks to cut the ball and is lucky not to chop it back onto the stumps
goes back in the crease and punches the ball off the back foot and goes up to long-on
gets on the front foot and gets a thick edge into the off-side
Wilson gets down early and sweeps the ball out to deep square leg

Anderson chips the ball in the air over the top of extra cover. Worrall chases after the ball and puts the dive in on the rope. Looks like he touched the rope and the ball at the same time and he signals the boundary. Brings up the 100 for Ireland
stays in the crease and defends the ball back to Zampa
goes back in the crease and hits the ball back to the bowler again
Hastings comes back into the attack and its a full ball to start. Wilson doesn't move his feet and hits the ball to short mid-off
late cut from Wilson, gets on top of the ball and hits it down to third man
Anderson gets onto the front foot and defends the ball into the off side
back-of-a-length delivery from Hastings, Anderson drags the ball through midwicket and they get another couple of runs
much better length from Hastings, Anderson gets in line and plays the ball back up the pitch
Hastings gets the edge. There isn't much pace on the ball and it drops well short of Wade behind the stumps
goes down the legside, and Wade takes off the bails. Wilson hadn't moved his feet and it's not out
drives the ball through the covers and they jog the single
Lovely shot from Anderson, gets down early and sweeps the ball fine through long leg. They have played the sweep shot very well this morning
gets to the pitch of the ball and clips it through the on side
he ball grips in the pitch and Wilson defends the ball into the off side again
Zampa goes down the legside and Wilson attempts another sweep. Gets a bit of the bat on the ball and it goes down past the keeper
Beautiful ball from Zampa, Anderson goes back in the crease and looks to defend the ball forward. It just goes past the outside edge
Wilson gets one on the pads and it's clipped away to deep square leg. Wilson turns back quickly for the second
slower ball from Hastings, Wilson stays rooted to the spot and defends the ball back up the pitch
Wilson shuffles across the stumps and uses the angle of the ball to guide it to deep square leg
slower ball again from Hastings, its straight and Anderson hits the ball up to mid-on
Hastings goes short and it's a touch too high and the umpire calls it a wide. Rightly so too
Anderson drops the ball into the off-side and sets off for the run, Smith runs in quickly and can't pick up the ball so they are safely home
Wilson gets another short ball and looks to pull the ball, doesn't get hold of it and it dribbles into the legside
Anderson clips the ball towards deep square leg, lands well before the fielder

another short ball from Worrall, cramps Wilson for room and it looks like he might have edged it to the keeper. Wilson refers it straight away and they have gone upstairs. On the ultra edge it looks like there is no contact with the bat. Looks like this might be overturned and it is as umpire Llong reverses his decision
goes down the legside and its called a wide. That's nine wides already today by Australia
Worrall over compensates and it's too far wide of off-stump, Wilson cuts the ball down to third man
much better ball, right on the stumps and Anderson can only defend the ball back down the pitch
it's cut hard towards point, Maxwell dives to his right and makes an excellent stop
it's another good length ball from the bowler, Anderson steps into the shot and hits it into the off-side. Eventful over there
full ball to start and it's turned into the on-side, stops Wilson from rotating the strike
beaten. Wilson goes for a late cut and the ball doesn't get high enough off the pitch. Can't get anything on it and it goes through to the keeper

dropped. Tough chance there for Boland. Wilson chips the ball back in the air towards the bowler. Boland gets his right hand down and it just drops to the ground in front of him. Would have been a great reflex catch
gets on the front foot and defends into the covers
goes short and Anderson misses with the attempted pull

Anderson stays in the crease again and looks to turn the ball into the off-side. Gets hit on the pad and the umpire's finger goes up. Anderson reviews the decision. No bat on the ball and it does look a touch high. It bounces in line and it's just clipping the top of the bails. It's the umpire's call and Anderson has to go
gets onto the front foot and defends the ball back to the bowler
good length ball again and Wilson gets onto the front foot and defends. Goes into the legside
on legstump and Wilson looks to clips the ball into the legside. Hits him on the pad and O'Brien calls him through for the run
O'Brien drives the ball into the covers and sets off for the run. O'Brien has to run around the bowler and just beats Warner's throw to the non-striker's end

another Wicket goes down! Wilson looks to run the ball down to third man and gets a thin edge through to the keeper. Wade takes the catch and throws the ball up in the air. Ireland in a bit of trouble here now!

What's happened here? Terry gets hit on the pads and Worrell goes up for the LBW. Terry wanders out of the crease and the ball gets thrown back in from slip and Terry is run out. Quick thinking there from Smith that leaves Ireland in even bigger trouble now. Terry is gone for a duck
O'Brien gets onto the front foot and defends the ball into the covers
nice shot from O'Brien, clips the ball through mid-wicket and they turn quickly for the second
goes short and it's down the legside, easy for O'Brien to duck out of the way
fuller ball and O'Brien gets onto the front foot and defends the ball into the covers again
touch shorter and O'Brien gets up on his toes and plays the ball back down the pitch
lovely shot from O'Brien, Boland angles the ball in and O'Brien pushes the ball hard past the bowler and its goes all the way to the rope
it's an inswinger from Worrall, Poynter judges the ball well and it goes through to the keeper
much straigter and Poynter needs to play at this one. Gets onto the front foot and defends the ball back down the pitch
it's another full ball from Worrall, Poynter cross-bats the ball into the off-side
Poynter gets off the mark as he slices the ball down towards Hastings at third man. Hasting makes a tumbling stop and they come back for the second
short and wide delivery from Worrall. Poynter hits the ball in the air through backward point. This time Hastings can't cut the ball off and it goes all the way to the boundary
Poynter gets onto the front foot and drives the ball through extra cover. Lovely shot from the Irish No. 7. Gets into double figures very quickly
clips the ball through square leg to rotate the strike
it's another inswinger and Poynter angles the ball down to long leg
Boland goes down the legside and it's yet another wide....
gets onto the front foot and drives the ball to mid-off
O'Brien gets onto the front foot and defends the ball into the covers
straighter ball from the bowler, allows O'Brien to clip it through square leg. It's a long chase for the fielder from square leg, so they comfortably get a couple
Boland goes short and it looks like it hits O'Brien in the chest and goes down the legside, Poynter calls for the run
on leg stump again and it's easy for O'Brien to turn the ball down to long leg
got him! It's a good length ball and Poynter is looking to play off the back foot. It comes back in off the pitch and takes out the off-stump. There was no foot movement from Poynter and he has to go
Dockrell gets on the front foot and drives the ball into the covers. Stopped well by the fielder
Dockrell stays in the crease and looks to defend. Gets hit on the pad and nobody appeals as it was going down the legside
it's back to outside the off-stump and Dockrell gets his bat high in the air. Goes through to the keeper
gets onto the front foot and drives the ball along the ground to mid-off. Dockrell sets off quickly and gets home safely to get off the mark
it's a good length ball back into Dockrell. He gets up on his toes and defends the ball into the off-side, no chance of a run there
it's another good length ball from Hastings, Dockrell stays in the crease and defends the ball forward again
gives Dockrell a little more room outside off-stump. Dockrell's only looking to defend and plays the ball into the covers
Hastings is looking to get the ball to reverse back into the batsman. Dockrell gets in line and defends the ball again
it's wide of off-stump again and this time Dockrell manages to angle it just wide of backward point. O'Brien calls him through for the run

O'Brien turns the ball through square leg and Ireland are now ahead of the score that they made against South Africa on Sunday. 20 overs to go here. Can they bat them out and give them something that they can defend?
it's outside off-stump and O'Brien is happy to defend the ball forward
O'Brien plants his front foot down and gets an inside edge onto the pads. Marsh is unlucky there as the ball almost gets through
drives the ball hard up to mid-off
it's on legstump again from Marsh and it's easy for Dockrell to clip the ball through square leg
straighter and a touch slower from Marsh, O'Brien gets on the front foot and tucks the ball up to mid-on
it's wide of off-stump again and O'Brien lets the ball sail harmlessly through to the keeper
Australia put a slip in and it's a little tempter outside off-stump, Dockrell fends at the ball and it goes through to the keeper
gets some bat on this ball and it drops into the off-side
Dockrell goes onto the back foot and punches the ball through the covers, it beats the fielders and they manage to come back for a comfortable second
it's another good length ball from Hastings, Dockrell gets onto the front foot and defends the ball into the covers
it's a touch slower again from Hastings, he has varied his speed well today. Dockrell stays on the front foot and defends
it's wide of off-stump and Dockrell slashes at the ball. Bailey dives to his left and makes a sharp stop at backward point
O'Brien plants his front foot down and clips the ball into the legside, it's in the air for a while and lands safe of the fielder on the rope
drops the ball into the off-side and O'Brien calls for the quick single. Dockrell sets off and gets home easily
goes down the legside and it's yet another wide
down the legside again, had flicked O'Brien's pad so it's not called a wide
gets onto the front foot and defends the ball forward
the ball goes down the legside again, just flicks O'Brien's pad again and it goes through to the keeper again
it's a much better line from  Marsh. It's on off-stump and O'Brien steps into the drive and hits the ball up to mid-off
Dockrell gives himself some room and cuts the ball past the point fielder
goes back in the crease and plays the ball back down the pitch
loops the ball up, Dockrell plays around the front pad and hits the ball into the legside
Zampa bowls him, it's the googly from Zampa and the ball turns back in a long way. Dockrell moved to the legside and tried to cut the ball. He misses and Zampa hits
gets onto the front foot and defends
McCarthy gets in a large stride and defends the ball back up the pitch
O'Brien gets on the front foot and defends the ball into the on-side. O'Brien still not taking any chances
angles the bat and guides the ball down towards third man, brings McCarthy back on strike
it's wide of off-stump and McCarthy swings his bat at the ball. Doesn't time it well and it goes to the point fielder
swings back into McCarthy, he gets up on his toes and plays the ball back down the pitch
gives too much width outside off-stump and McCarthy isn't going to miss out on that one! It's cut hard into the ground and goes past point and cover, much-needed boundary for Ireland
doesn't look to add to his runs as this ball is defended back down the pitch to the bowler
Zampa gives O'Brien some room and is cut into the covers. Australia are happy to get McCarthy on strike
goes back in the crease and turns the ball round the corner to get off strike again
gets a large stride down the pitch and defends
O'Brien reaches forward and clips the ball through mid-wicket for an easy run
gives himself some room and almost misses a faster ball from Zampa
gets hit on the pad as the ball is going down the legside. there is only a muffled appeal from the bowler as the ball was drifting away
gets onto the front foot again and defends the ball into the covers
that's a chance for Smith, its in the air and even though Smith dives at short cover he can't get a hand on the ball. Races across the ground and goes to the boundary
goes short and O'Brien pulls the ball down to long-leg
gets forward again and pushes the ball into the on-side
wide of off stump and McCarthy pushes at the ball, it beats a diving point fielder and it races to the rope. Lovely shot from McCarthy
another wild delivery down the legside from Boland, Wade can't gather the ball and the Irish batsmen get some extra runs
gets hit on the pads and Boland appeals for leg-before, you can tell from the keeper that the ball was going down the legside and the umpire isnt interested
full ball from Zampa, O'Brien digs the ball out well
gets on the front foot and defends the ball to backward point

Big Wicket for Australia! Zampa bowls the ball out of the back of the hand and O'Brien is looking to edge it past the keeper. The wrong'un turns more than he expects and gets hit on the back pad. The umpire is in no doubt and O'Brien has to go!
left-handed Murtagh goes back in the crease and turns the ball into the legside to get off the mark
goes back in the crease and pulls the ball through square leg again
stays in the crease and hits the ball back up the pitch
good length ball again from Worrall, McCarthy looks to turn the ball into the legside. Can only hit it back to the bowler
another inswinger from Worrall, McCarthy gets forward and plays the ball into the legside again
the ball comes back in to McCarthy again, gets on the front foot and defends
a short ball that seems to lose pace off the pitch, McCarthy is through the shot before the ball gets there and it bounces before it goes through to the keeper
angles the ball to short third man and McCarthy sets off for the run. Bailey is onto the ball quickly and Murtagh sends him back
McCarthy hits the ball into the covers and a mis-field means we don't get a first maiden of the day
gets onto the front foot and hits the ball along the ground to point
much more air from Zampa and McCarthy hits the ball back to the bowler
defends the ball to cover
hits the ball on the volley back to the bowler
goes back in the crease, watches for the spin and defends
there is a Maiden today! McCarthy can only hit the ball back along the ground to the bowler and it ends Zampa's over
Murtagh goes back in the crease and defends the ball back to the bowler. Worrall is going around the wicket here
Worrall angles the ball back into Murtagh, defends the ball into the off side
Murtagh had seen enough of that and clears the front leg and hits the ball to the mid-wicket boundary. Think that it surprised everyone there!
Murtagh is backing away to every delivery and looks to smash the ball over the off-side this time. Can't get anything on it and it goes through to the keeper
that was close to being a wide! Murtagh had given himself some room again and its a wide yorker from Worrall. Just inside the tram line
Murtagh chips the ball in the air, Bailey is at short midwicket and its just out of his reach and lands safe
gets on the front foot and hits the ball along the ground to long off
gets down the pitch and drives the ball through the covers, easy single
goes back in the crease and the ball keeps low, Murtagh just manages to get the bat down in time
clips the ball to short midwicket
gives himself some room and looks to cut the ball, lucky not to edge it through to the keeper
Zampa's last ball gets driven up to long-on to finish what has been some impressive bowling. His figures: 10-1-37-3
Worrall is still coming around the wicket to Murtagh, Murtagh doesn't move his feet and defends the ball into the off side
again there is no foot movement from Murtagh and its knocked into the covers again
Australia had just removed the slip and wouldn't you guess? Murtagh gets an outside edge that flies just where slip would be and it goes to the boundary. Smith hold his head in his hands
leg-side wide
Murtagh smashes the ball from the crease again, can't beat the mid-off fielder though
opens the bat-face and hits the ball over the top of the cover fielder. It lands safe and they are still inching towards 200 here
still no foot movement and the ball is hit up to the mid-off fielder again
it's a ball outside off-stump from Hastings, hits the ball out to the cover sweeper
Hasting gets a slip put in for Murtagh and this time its sliced through backward point. Fielded on the boundary at long leg
McCarthy guides the ball towards backward point, can't beat the fielder
McCarthy gets a ball in the arc and swings at the ball, it goes high in the air and Bailey gets under the ball at point and takes a comfortable catch
the batsmen had crossed whilst the ball was in the air and so Murtagh was on strike. He chips a ball from outside off into Bailey's hands at backward point. Tame end to the innings

inn2.comm: well, that's not a good start from Chase. It's on legstump and it's clipped down to long leg
on legstump again and this time Warner can't get this one away and it goes to square leg
now that's a shot from Warner! Chase slants the ball across him and it's driven through extra cover and it races to the rope
it's another boundary, not as classy this time. It's short and wide and Warner slashes at the ball, goes to the third man boundary
Warner goes hard at the ball again and cuts it in the air past backward point. Poynter dives on the boundary to stop the ball
all the fielders are on the edge of the circle so Warner drops the ball into the off-side and takes off for the run. Clever thinking and 12 comes off that first over
not with the first ball though, goes down the legside and it's a wide
clips the ball off the pads, long way for the fielder to run and they get a second
much better ball from McCarthy, good length and the ball pops up. Warner gets in line and defends the ball back down the pitch
Warner clips the ball towards square leg again, Dockrell runs in quickly and stops the run
it's short and on legstump, Warner helps the ball on the way down to long leg for another run
Khawaja clips the ball past Dockrell at square leg, he has to chase the ball back and the runs keep on coming
it's full outside off-stump, Khawaja gets forward and hits the ball into the covers and its stopped by the fielder. Great start once again for Australia
its a better ball from Chase but it still goes to the boundary. Its outside off-stump and Warner drives through the ball and it goes to the extra cover boundary
good length ball from Chase, Warner gets some bat on the ball and defends into the covers
waits for the ball and hits it out to the point fielder
yet another boundary ball from Chase, its wide of off stump and Warner bisects the fielders at point and cover to get the boundary
coming rounnd the wicket still doesn't stop the runs, Warner angles the bat and guides it down to third man
Chase looks to go short and it doesn't bounce much off the wicket, Khawaja plays a late cut down to third man
it's driven into the covers and bounces just before Terry at cover. Almost takes off his head as he ducks out of the way. Goes to the boundary
the first ball that beats the bat, fends at a ball outside off-stump and misses. Goes through to Wilson behind the stumps
clips the ball to the square leg fielder
goes down the legside again, called wide

chance goes begging for Ireland! Looks to pull the ball into the legside and the ball flies high in the air. Chase runs in from long leg and the ball goes into his hands and back out of them. Ireland can't afford to drop any chances
late cuts the ball down to third man
gets onto the front foot and defends the ball back down the pitch to the bowler
yet another wide, been far too many of them from both sides today. Down the legside
pace off the ball from Murtagh, his stock ball. Gets in line and defends into the pitch
slower ball again, hit back to the bowler. Murtagh gets his right hand down on the ball and deflects it into the legside, they scamper the single
hits the ball through mid-wicket, Anderson has to dive to his left to stop the ball
it's a good length ball that Khawaja defends out towards point
steps down the pitch to change the angle, Khawaja hits the ball up to mid-on and the fielder runs in to stop the run
Warner goes for a big one! It's in the slot and Warner smashes the ball over the top of the long-off boundary. Cracking shot
another ball on legstump and it's clipped through square leg. The Irish bowlers seem to be having trouble with their line to the left-handed batsmen
Gosh! That brings up the fifty partnership. It's flat-batted back past the bowler by Khawaja. No point chasing that one
a dot ball! Not been many of them so far, defended into the covers by Khawaja
another ball on legstump from McCarthy, Wilson appeals for the catch down the legside. Clipped the pad on the way through, so nothing from the umpire
wide of off-stump again from the bowler, Khawaja drives hard at the ball and Porterfield ends up diving over the ball at point. Races away to the rope again
Murtagh is bowling stump-to-stump and doesn't give Warner any room. Defended back to the bowler
on legstump again and Warner waits for the ball and clips it towards square leg. The fielder is back on the edge of the circle and it's an easy single
clipped through square leg again and this is far too comfortable for Australia so far

Warner turns the ball into the leg side and Khawaja charges down the wicket. He is halfway down when Warner shouts no. Khawaja turns and dives back in at the non-striker's end, beats Murtagh's throw back in
clips the ball through mid-wicket and they scamper across for the single
slower ball outside off stump and it's driven to the cover fielder. Good over for Ireland with only three runs off it
Chase comes back on from the other end and is around the wicket to Warner. Goes down the legside and it's yet another wide
this one tucks Warner up for room and it's turned up towards mid-wicket. Gets another run
late-cuts the ball down to third man
Chase goes short and there is really no pace to it, Warner knows that there is no fielder at long leg and just helps it around the corner
Warner is at it as well. Chase pitches the ball up and smashes it over the long-on boundary. It just flies and flies and flies
Chase goes for a slower ball and loses his line, Warner clips the ball through square leg and they jog the single
clips the ball through square leg again, now how many runs have Australia scored there so far?
gets onto the front foot and defends the ball into the covers
slower delivery and it sits up nicely for Khawaja, who pulls the ball to the square leg boundary. Terry makes a diving stop on the rope and keeps it to one

cutter from Murtagh and its stops on Warner, the ball pops back to the bowler. Murtagh jumps up and takes the catch just above his head. No celebration from the bowler. Warner will be unhappy to have got out like that
it's a better line to the right-handed Smith, he stays in the crease and hits the ball back to the bowler
touch of inswing there from Murtagh, Smith judges the ball well and hits it back along the ground to the bowler. Good over from Murtagh there
lots of pace off the ball from O'Brien, looks to keep the ball tight to the stump and Khawaja plays it into the legside
Khawaja comes down the wicket and looks to put O'Brien off his length. Knocks the ball into the covers
O'Brien bowls this one short and Khawaja rocks back in the crease and pulls the ball out to Dockrell on the square leg boundary
slower ball with a touch of outswing, Smith moves across the stumps and defends the ball into the off-side
Smith shuffles across the stumps again and turns this ball into the legside, stopped by the fielder
pace off ball from O'Brien again, Smith clips the ball through square leg again. Anderson runs in from long leg and that ends an impressive powerplay for Australia
yet again stump-to-stump stuff from Murtagh, turned into the legside and short mid-wicket fields the ball
full ball driven through mid-wicket and Terry cuts the ball off just before the rope

Khawaja comes down the pitch and clips the ball through square leg. Chase dives on the rope and uses all of his tall frame to stop the ball. Terry backs up and throws the ball back in. Saved a couple of runs there
hits the ball towards mid-off and sets off straightaway. McCarthy picks up the ball and throws at the non-striker's end. Misses the stumps but Khawaja would have been home anyway
good length ball which is defended back to the bowler
112.9kph ball from Murtagh, Smith knows that he has plenty of time and is happy to play the ball back to the bowler
Wilson comes up behind the stumps to keep Khawaja in the crease, clips the ball into the legside and they scamper the single
wide of off-stump from O'Brien, Smith moves to the off-side and defends the ball back up to the bowler
Smith stays in the crease and gets a thick edge down to Murtagh at third man
Wilson comes back up again behind the stumps, Khawaja gets on the front foot and defends into the covers
another good length ball and it's driven up to mid-off
good length ball again and its driven through mid-off again, Ireland had moved the fielder back onto the boundary so its an easy single for Australia

Wilson comes up to the stumps for Murtagh too. The bowler drops it short, and it sits up nicely for Khawaja. It gets pulled through mid-wicket and even though Terry dives on the rope, he can't stop the boundary
gets on the front foot and defends the ball into the covers
wide of off-stump and its driven to O'Brien at cover. No chance of a run there
good length ball again from Murtagh, its angled across Khawaja and he slashes the ball out to O'Brien at cover again
another good length ball, pops up and Khawaja does well to control the shot as he plays the ball into the off-side
a touch straighter and it lets Khawaja tuck the ball down to long leg
now that's a way to greet the bowler! Its in the arc and Khawaja hits the ball over the top of the bowler's head and its goes into the stands. Struck the ball superbly.
gets on the front foot and defends back to the bowler
gets some width from O'Brien, plays the late cut down to third man
O'Brien goes for a slower ball bouncer and its goes over Smith's head and gets called for another wide
Smith is shuffling across the stumps again and clips this slower ball through square leg
on a good length, straight at middle stump. Khawaja hits the ball to mid-on and there is a loud shout of 'no' from Smith
great stop from Terry. The ball is cut into the covers and just before it gets to Terry it takes another bad hop. Terry reaches out with his left hand and just stops the ball. Big smile on his face
tidy delivery again from Murtagh, Smith gets in line and defends
outside off-stump and Smith gets onto the front foot and defends the ball into the off-side. Murtagh runs over and fields
another ball under 120kph, Smith is happy to take his time and defends the ball back down the pitch
Murtagh strays onto the legstump and its clipped down to long leg. Australia move onto 99
still no width from Murtagh and Khawaja can't get the ball away. Defended into the off-side
another nurdle into the legside and that brings the 100 up for Australia. Going along very serenely here at the moment
O'Brien goes down the legside and it's yet another wide
outside off-stump and Khawaja stays in the crease and hits the ball up to mid-off
it's far too easy for Khawaja, another ball clipped through the legside and its out to Dockrell on the boundary
outside off-stump and Smith is happy to defend the ball into the covers
slower ball again from O'Brien, defended into the legside

lovely placement from Smith. The field is packed on the off-side and he manages to find a gap and the ball goes out towards the extra cover boundary. Dockrell chases the ball back and stops it just before the rope
Smith is happy to see out the over and defends the ball back to the bowler
wide outside off-stump to start from Dockrell. Khawaja leans forward and hits it out through the covers
Smith stays in the crease, waits for the spin and defends
Smith stays rooted to the spot and hits the ball up to long-off. Jogs the single
clipped through square leg for another single
Smith has seen enough and comes down the wicket to Dockrell. Didn't get to the pitch of the ball and just goes over the head of the fielder at mid-on. Has enough on it to go to the rope
spins back into Smith and he gets forward and defends. That's drinks
gets a good length ball which is driven up to long-on
slower ball outside off stump. Smith dabs the ball down and Wilson runs up from behind the stumps to field
O'Brien is back bowling stump-to-stump, Smith gets in line and plays the ball back to the bowler
O'Brien goes short and its too short for Umpire Llong, calls it wide
Smith gets onto the front foot and hits the ball back into the ground. O'Brien picks the ball up on his follow through
it's a shorter ball and Smith looks to pull the ball, doesn't get a good connection on the ball and it goes into his own pads. O'Brien runs down the pitch to field
Smith moves across the stumps again and clips the ball down through square leg. Terry runs in quickly to cut off the second
too far outside off-stump and Smith waits for the ball and cuts the ball through backward point. Terry can't cut it off and it goes to the rope
Smith comes down the pitch and gets hit on the pad, there is a loud appeal from Wilson. umpire not interested
gets on the front foot and drives the ball into the covers
goes back in the crease and cuts the ball out to the cover sweeper
goes back in the crease and defends the ball into the pitch
goes down the legside and its called a wide. Wilson takes off the bails but Khawaja is home
takes the outside edge and lands just short of Stirling at slip. Unlucky for Dockrell
clips the ball through the legside again and Smith gets another
O'Brien drops short and its pulled out to the square leg boundary. Dockrell stops the ball on the rope
a big swing and miss from Smith. Looks to pull the ball into the legside and misses. Signs of aggression from Smith
loopy slower ball from O'Brien. Smith gets on the front foot and defends forward
loopy slower ball from O'Brien. Smith gets on the front foot and defends forward
slower ball that Smith pulls into the legside and that brings up the fifty partnership. Terry fumbles the ball as he picks it up and they decide against the second run
comes down the pitch and hits the ball along the ground to long-off
that's the fifty for Khawaja! It sits up nicely and he cuts the ball to the deep point boundary. McCarthy dives on the rope and can't stop the boundary
goes down early and paddles the ball down to fine leg
gets to the pitch of the ball and hits it up to long-on
turns the ball round the corner and starts running straight away, gets home with easy
gets forward and defends the ball into the legside
McCarthy comes back into the attack and the ball is punched up to mid-on
looks to go short and Smith pulls the ball to the square leg boundary. Perfectly bisects the fielders
gets up on his toes and defends the ball into the covers
good length ball turned into the on-side and picked up by the fielder
gets onto the front foot again and defends into the covers
slower ball from McCarthy, turns the ball into the legside to finish the over
Chase comes back on and gets a full ball hit back to him
wide of off-stump and the ball is cut into the covers, Porterfield makes a smart stop of the ball
Chase oversteps and that's going to be a free hit coming up
Chase goes short and Khawaja swivels and it goes over the top of the long leg boundary. What a cracking shot from Khawaja
clipped into the legside and they set off quickly for the run
slower ball that Smith turns into the legside and its to the close fielder
down the legside and Smith swings at the ball, gets the edge and it goes to the fine leg boundary
another ball on legstump and its glanced to the fine leg boundary. The runs just keep on coming
outside off stump this time and its driven through extra cover this time. No chance of stopping that one
fuller ball from McCarthy as he come round the wicket. Clipped along the ground to the short midwicket fielder
slower delivery again from McCarthy, driven to the cover fielder
McCarthy drops short again and its pulled out to the square leg boundary. Stopped on the boundary
McCarthy drops short again and this one doesn't bounce much. Smith has to bend his knees as he hits the ball out to deep mid-wicket
hit into the covers and Stirling makes a smart stop at short extra cover
slower ball clipped off the pads and goes out towards the mid-wicket boundary
Chase strays onto the legstump and its clipped down to long leg again. So many runs scored on the legside today
full and wide outside off-stump, Smith jabs the bat down and it goes to the point boundary
inswinger from Chase, Smith defends into the legside
same delivery from Chase and this time Smith gets its squarer on the legside. They jog the single
good length ball defended back towards the bowler by Smith
full ball smashed back towards the bowler. Hits McCarthy on the foot and it looks to have hurt him there. Ouch!
goes short and Smith pulls the ball through square leg
comes round the wicket and Khawaja helps the ball on the way down to long leg
wide of off-stump and Smith is happy to defend the ball into the covers
Smith stays in the crease and pulls the ball into the legside, its wide enough of the fielder to get a single
goes back in the crease and defends into the covers
cuts the ball to deep point and Terry cuts the ball off on the boundary
clips the ball through the legside and its stopped on the mid-wicket boundary
stays in the crease and sweeps the ball out to deep square leg
hits the ball through the covers and that's the 100 partnership up for Australia
guides the ball out to point and there is no run
a full toss from McCarthy and its hit over the bowlers head and keeps on going. Hits the sightscreen
another full toss from McCarthy and he misses out on this one as he looks to cut the ball
that's the fifty for Smith, plays the ball across his pads and it goes down to long leg.
another chance goes begging. Khawaja hits the ball in the air and Chase runs over from mid-on and just can't catch up with the ball.
its wide of off-stump and its driven hard through cover for another four. This is going to end very quickly here....
a good length ball from McCarthy and its knocked back to the bowler
gets onto the front foot and clips the ball through square leg again
hits the ball to Stirling at cover
yorker from Dockrell, Smith hits the ball back to him
goes short and its pulled down to long leg by Smith
turns the ball round the corner and its another simply taken single
short and wide and Khawaja has all the time in the world to cut the ball through point. Goes to the boundary
a short ball and Smith pulls it into the legside, stopped on the boundary

goes down the legside and Ireland are sure that Khawja has got something on the ball. They review it, no harm in doing so with only 5 runs needed. Doesn't look like there is anything on Ultra Edge. So its just a wide then.
stump-to-stump again from O'Brien. Khawaja stays in the crease and hits the ball back to the bowler
wide outside off-stump, Smith doesn't move his feet and misses the ball.
Smith turns a good length ball up towards Terry at mid-on. Its wide enough to get a single
clips the ball into the legside and the scores are tied.
a good length ball again from O'Brien, Smith turns the ball into the legside and its straight to the fielder again

Dockrell bowls the ball on legstump and its clipped to square leg again. Terry can't gather the ball cleanly and they decide to run. Australia win! With that scrambled clip into the legside, Australia complete a nine wicket win with 119 balls remaining.
